page.title: 05RECREATION IN STAINFORTH (1)
page.content: Since Stainforth is in the middle of the Dales, and quite a long way away from any large town, there isn't much in the way of recreation. Many people spend their time in outdoor pursuits such as shooting or fishing, or swimming and skin-diving in Stainforth Force in the summer, but there are some indoor ones as well. Knight Stainforth caravan site provides activities such as pool, table-tennis and the odd video game. This is mostly for younger people. The Craven Heifer in the centre of Stainforth provides pool and darts for older people. The vicar of Stainforth, with the help of a number of other churchgoers, runs a youth club known as 'Teenage Time'. This meets every few weeks or so in members' houses in the surrounding villages of Langcliffe and Horton-in-Ribblesdale.
